alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 23 at 6:56AM EDT until March 23 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Northwestern Clay County in southwestern Georgia... West central Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... Quitman County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 745 AM EDT/645 AM CDT/. * At 656 AM EDT/556 AM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located near Abbeville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Georgetown, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Wire Bridge, Walter F George Lake, Bonapartes Retreat, Edwin, Standleys Store, Watson Crossroads, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Crossroads, Ricks Place, Graball, Thomas Mill Creek, Hatcher, Morris and Bethel. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM EDT/600 AM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM EDT/600 AM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama.
